monogr.title: Archivio di Stato di Venezia – Exhibition “Le Donne Benefattrici” (Women Benefactors)
monogr.note: Documentary exhibition highlighting women’s artistic and historical profiles in Venetian archives (15th–18th centuries), curated by Michela Dal Borgo and Alessandra Schiavon. Included archival wills, notarial acts, and letters featuring figures such as Anna Notaras Paleologhina, Veronica Franco, and Morosina Morosini. Presented at Palazzo Mocenigo di San Stae, March–June 2014.

relatedItem.title: Francesco Griselini Collection Donation Ceremony

div.head: Historical Context
div.p: Following the fall of Constantinople in 1453, Byzantine intellectuals, nobles, and clergy migrated toward Venice and other Italian centers. Among them, Anna Notaras Paleologhina stands out as a key cultural mediator between East and West.

She fostered the establishment of the Greek Orthodox community in Venice and supported the construction of San Giorgio dei Greci, completed in 1573 — a lasting symbol of Byzantine faith and identity within the Venetian Republic.
